alert.note: Alert for Audrain; Marion; Monroe; Ralls; Shelby (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 3:02AM CDT until June 17 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Ralls County in northeastern Missouri... Audrain County in central Missouri... Southern Shelby County in northeastern Missouri... Southwestern Marion County in northeastern Missouri... Monroe County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 345 AM CDT. * At 301 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Shelbina to near Madison to near Higbee, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...The Moberly ASOS reported a 58 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Shelbina, Madison, Woodlawn and Maud around 305 AM CDT. Granville around 310 AM CDT. Paris around 320 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Santa Fe, Mexico, Perry, Laddonia and Center. This also includes Union Covered Bridge Historic Site and Mark Twain Lake Recreational Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
